item.title: LEVEL-5 president Akihiro Hino has begun writing Inazuma Eleven: Victory Road sequel
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Switch 2
  • Xbox Series

"I will do my best to deliver surprise and excitement to everyone once again."

LEVEL-5 president and CEO Akihiro Hino has already begun writing the script for the sequel to Inazuma Eleven: Victory Road, he said during today’s INA-DAI broadcast.

“As for the sequel to Inazuma Eleven: Victory Road, I have already started writing the scenario,” Hino said. “As a ‘new Inazuma Eleven‘ that begins in the Reiwa era, I will do my best to deliver surprise and excitement to everyone once again. Please look forward to future announcements.”

LEVEL-5 previously said player data from Inazuma Eleven: Victory Road would carry over to a potential sequel. The company reaffirmed this today as well.

Further information was not announced.

(Editor’s Note: Despite its recent release, Inazuma Eleven: Victory Road was announced in July 2016—during the Heisei era. The Reiwa era began on May 1, 2019.)
